messages.content:
Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
thermal sigin, sigout; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter real sigin_offset = 2; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
input sigout; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter real gain = 0; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
V(sigout) <+ gain*(V(sigin) + sigin_offset); Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
V(sigout) <+ gain*(sigin_offset - V(sigin)); Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter real sigout_offset = 0; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
   analog if (0) Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
   analog

 Correction Criteria：The conditional 'if (0)' ensures the assignment statement is never executed, preventing signal amplification. This violates the core functionality of the amplifier module by permanently disabling output generation.
